column4: I know almost nothing about the non-free driver, so if your matter is with that, perhaps someone else can, but we have one of those cards here and it should work reasonably well with the open source driver as well.
my problem is that it worked until update, non-free driver fglrx and I try 8.28.8driver from ATI website too, and of course I try open-source, but non of them worked with 3D acceleration :(
my problem is that it worked until update, non-free driver fglrx and I try 8.28.8driver from ATI website too, and of course I try open-source, but non of them worked with 3D acceleration :(

You updated to edgy? I had heard of that happening and did not do it (that being one of the reasons). Sorry, maybe someone else knows what to do
no its Dapper, 6.06.1 LTS, so how can I install the FOSS driver, remove fglrx and install xserver-xorg-video-ati, as arrenlex advice me?
arrenlex usually gives good advice, so go for it.
